text.__SUMMARY__: Echis carinatus sinhaleyus is a venomous viper subspecies endemic to Sri Lanka.
text.Common Names:
Sri Lankan saw-scaled viper.
Known as vali polanga(වැලි පොලඟා) (can also be spelt as veli polanga) by the Sinhala speaking community. The vernacular name veli polanga translates as "sand viper".
text.Geographic range: It is found in Sri Lanka.The type locality is described as "Chavakachcheri, Jaffna Peninsula" (Northern Province, Sri Lanka).

Deraniyagala PEP. 1951. Some New Races of the Snakes Eryx, Callophis [sic] and Echis. Spolia Zeylanica 26 (2): 147-150. ("Echis carinatus sinhaleyus ssp. nov.", pp. 148-149, Tables III-IV).
Golay P, Smith HM, Broadley DG, Dixon JR, McCarthy CJ, Rage J-C, Schätti B, Toriba M. 1993. Endoglyphs and Other Major Venomous Snakes of the World. A Checklist. Geneva: Azemiops. 478 pp.
